Class EditItemActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.app.Activity

  • public class EditItemActivity
extends android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity
    This is the activity for adding or editing an item.
    1. Mainly there are 7 functions:
      • doFinishEdit
      • onCreate
      • initialisePaging
      • setFragmentIndicator
      • onCreateOptionMenu
      • confirm
      • setFragmentIndicator

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu)
        This boolean function is to activate the option menu. Initialize the contents of the Activity's standard options menu.
        You should place your menu items in to menu. For this method to be called, you must have first called setHasOptionsMenu(boolean).
        See Activity.onCreateOptionsMenu for more information.
        Parameters:
        menu - The options menu in which you place your items.
        See Also:
        setHasOptionsMenu(boolean), onPrepareOptionsMenu(Menu)

      • confirm

        public void confirm(MenuItem item)
        1. The item of the option menu will call this function to confirm the change.
          • It will find the needed views by their id
          • It will test the user chose to either edit or add an Item
          • It will save the change that a user made
        Parameters:
        item - The option item which belongs to the option menu.
        Since:
        2015-03-02

      • setReceiptBitmap

        Active the camera button.
        The classes it contains is similar to the EditClaimActivity.
        Since:
        2015-03-02
